nfoscarini wrote:
> Thanks for the quick reply.
> 
> I'm running Windows XP.
> 
> I reviewed the install docs, and found that I didn't create the
> profile folder under the conf directory. Now, when I create a job
> using that profile it works fine. I just ran a crawl on a website, and
> all the URL's are resolving their DNS IP addresses.
> 
> When I look at the default profile. I realize I don't know much about
> configuring a crawl job on Heritrix. Could use some more documentation
> on what all the modules do, and when to use them.

There is much documentation on 1.x in the user manual:

http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/index.html

Settings in the web UI have at least a brief description of their 
purpose and usual default value. Also, once you supply an alternate 
implementation class for a 'module' or 'submodule' (on those respective 
configuration pages), an 'info' or '?' link will further describe the 
chosen implementation.

Beyond those, the mailing list archives, project wiki, and source code 
(viewable online at http://crawler.archive.org/xref/index.html ) are the 
next line of reference.

(In 2.x, there will be links from the web UI to documentation pages 
anyone can improve on the project wiki.)

> What software do you guys use to read the ARC files generated by a crawl?

There's the ArcReader class bundled in Heritrix:

  http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.html

There are also the tools available at the companion 'archive-access' 
Sourceforge project:

  http://archive-access.sourceforge.net/

...which include contributed ARC readers in C++ (libarc, from Tom 
Emerson) and Python (Hedaern, from Mark Williamson of HanzoWeb).

There is also the Perl 'BNF Arc Tools' from the Bibliothï¿½que nationale 
de France:

  http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?BnfArcTools

- Gordon @ IA
